articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi, James Mackenzie
articles.description: Israel targeted a Gaza school on Thursday that it said contained an Hamas compound, killing fighters involved in the Oct. 7 attack that sparked the eight-month war, but Gaza media said the strike killed at least 27 people seeking shelter.
articles.title: Israel says jets strike school containing Hamas compound, Gaza media says 27 killed

articles.author: Elizabeth Pineau, John Irish, Ingrid Melander
articles.description: Veterans and world leaders meet in Normandy on Thursday to mark the 80th anniversary of the June 6, 1944 D-Day landings, when more than 150,000 Allied soldiers arrived in France by sea and air to drive out the forces of Nazi Germany.
articles.title: World leaders, veterans, commemorate D-Day's 80th anniversary in Normandy

articles.author: Dmitry Antonov, Andrew Osborn
articles.description: The Kremlin said on Thursday that Western nations which supply Ukraine with weapons to directly strike Russian territory will definitely face consequences after President Vladimir Putin said he was considering arming the West's enemies in retaliation.
articles.title: Kremlin says Kyiv's backers will face consequences after Putin says he may arm West's enemies
Exclusive: NAACP asks Biden to halt weapons to Israel as he seeks to shore up Black voter support

articles.author: Ali Sawafta, Raneen Sawafta
articles.description: Israeli forces killed three Palestinians and wounded at least 13 others in a raid on the occupied West Bank city of Jenin on Thursday, the Palestinian Health Ministry and medics said.
articles.title: Israeli forces kill three Palestinians, wound over 10 in West Bank raid, Palestinians say

articles.author: Jan Strupczewski
articles.description: Voting began in the Netherlands on Thursday at the start of a four-day election across the European Union to a new European Parliament that will face mounting security, industrial and political challenges.
articles.title: Netherlands kicks off four-day European Parliament election

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Prince Harry has been given permission to appeal against the rejection of his legal challenge to the British government's decision to take away his police protection when he is in Britain, his lawyer said on Thursday.
articles.title: Prince Harry wins right to challenge UK police protection ruling

articles.author: Tanvi Mehta
articles.description: Lack of jobs, high inflation and falling income in India led voters to rein in support for Prime Minister Narendra Modi in the general election where his Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) failed to win a majority, according to a survey.
articles.title: Modi's appeal clouded in India election by prices, jobs, graft, survey says

articles.author: Kopano Gumbi, Nellie Peyton
articles.description: African National Congress leaders held talks on Thursday to try to agree on potential partners to form a new South African government after the party lost its parliamentary majority for the first time in the democratic era.
articles.title: South Africa's ANC meets to decide on preferred partners to govern

articles.author: Lucy Papachristou, Filipp Lebedev, Mark Trevelyan
articles.description: Russia said on Thursday it had detained a Frenchman suspected of gathering information about the Russian military, a serious charge at a time of acute tension between Moscow and the West over the war in Ukraine.
articles.title: Russia arrests French nonprofit worker suspected of collecting military intelligence
